transliteration:
ācārāt labhate hy āyur ācārād īpsitāḥ prajāḥ |
ācārād dhanam akṣayyam ācāro hanty alakṣaṇam || 4.156||
sph_interpretive_translation: From conduct arises life itself; from conduct arise desired progeny. From conduct comes imperishable wealth. Conduct destroys the unseen evil.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in alignment with universal Dharma-vyavahara
Causation flows directly from individual and collective conduct
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by one's adherence to Dharma-conduct
Restoration occurs through re-establishing righteous conduct
Consciousness alignment manifests as purified vyavahara
executable_legal_axioms: IF an entity demonstrates sustained dharmic conduct THEN increase access to life-supporting resources
IF conduct aligns with prajā-dharma THEN grant reproductive and lineage rights
IF financial action stems from dharmic conduct THEN ensure resource sustainability
IF unseen harm manifests THEN trace it back to a breakdown in conduct-based integrity
supreme_court_application: Supreme judicial authority must assess not just overt acts but underlying patterns of conduct that generate societal outcomes. Responsibility lies not in isolated events but in systemic alignment or misalignment with foundational Dharma-conduct.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Truth-discernment (Nyāya) reveals that effects follow causes rooted in conduct. Unseen harms dissolve when causal conduct is realigned. Retribution has no place where causality is understood as sequential and reversible through conscious correction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Conduct Audit Protocol: Evaluate all actions against baseline dharmic alignment
Lineage Restoration Process: Reconnect individuals with generative behavioral inheritance
Wealth Purification Cycle: Redirect economic activity toward non-depleting outcomes
Invisible Harm Dissolution Sequence: Identify root conduct deviation and restore energetic balance
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma stands restored through conduct-consciousness alignment. Reality operates without punishment. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
